parts.text:
SLURM

```json
{
  "application": "SLURM",
  "details": {
    "nodes": 1,
    "tasks_per_node": 1,
    "cpus_per_task": 16,
    "memory": "64GB",
    "gpu": 1,
    "modules": {
      "rocm": "5.4.3",
      "gromacs": "2022.3.amd1_174",
      "singularity": "/shared/apps/bin/gromacs_2022.3.amd1_174.sif"
    },
    "mpi": {
      "mpirun": "mpirun -np 1",
      "benchmark": "STMV",
      "parameters": {
        "nsteps": 100000,
        "resetstep": 90000,
        "ntomp": 64,
        "noconfout": true,
        "nb": "gpu",
        "bonded": "cpu",
        "pme": "gpu",
        "v": true,
        "nstlist": 100,
        "gpu_id": 0,
        "s": "/tmp/$USER/gpu1-$$/stmv/topol.tpr",
        "g": "/tmp/$USER/gpu1-$$/stmv/md.log",
        "e": "/tmp/$USER/gpu1-$$/stmv/ener.eder",
        "cpo": "/tmp/$USER/gpu1-$$/stmv/state.cpt"
      }
    }
  }
}
```

This script uses the SLURM workload manager to run a GROMACS simulation on a GPU-enabled node.  The script utilizes modules to load the necessary software (ROCm, GROMACS) and then uses singularity to run the simulation.  The script also uses MPI to distribute the workload across multiple cores.  The script includes specific parameters for the simulation, such as the number of steps, the number of threads to use, and the GPU ID.  The script also includes some basic error handling.
